test.name: Do a GET Request and validate the response code and response body

kw.name: Create Session
kw.doc: Create Session: create a HTTP session to a server
kw.msg: Creating Session using : alias=mysession, url=http://application:5000/, headers={}, cookies={}, auth=None, timeout=None, proxies=None, verify=True, debug=0

kw.name: GET On Session
kw.doc: Sends a GET request on a previously created HTTP Session.
kw.msg: GET Request : url=http://application:5000/machines path_url=/machines headers={'User-Agent': 'python-requests/2.28.2', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Accept': '*/*', 'Connection': 'keep-alive'} body=None

kw.name: Status Should Be
kw.doc: Fails if response status code is different than the expected.

test.doc: This test case verifies that the response code of the GET Request should be 200, the response body contains the 'title' key with value as 'London', and the response body contains the key 'location_type'.
